oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pocket testament of Sgt. Johnson Basham West, Co. B, 2nd Ky. Cav. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: American Bible Society Testament dated 1852 with severe battle damage to upper left corner. The pocket testament saved the life of Sgt. Johnson Basham West, Co. B, 2nd Ky. Cav. Regt., CSA during a skirmish at Muldraugh's Hill, Ky. in December, 1862.; West was captured during Morgan's Ohio Raid at Hawkinsport, Ohio on July 20, 1863 and sent to Camp Douglas, Ill and Point Lookout, Md. prison camps. He took his parole May 3, 1865. He became a doctor after the war in Nashville, Tenn.
